data.title: Philip Emeagwali: From Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia
data.meta_description: Philip Emeagwali - Free download as Word Doc (.doc), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Philip Emeagwali is a Nigerian-born computer scientist who won the 1989 Gordon Bell Prize for his use of a Connection Machine supercomputer containing over 65,536 processors to help analyze petroleum fields. He dropped out of school in Nigeria due to the civil war and later obtained multiple degrees from universities in the United States. Emeagwali received numerous awards for his work, but some of his technical claims lack citations and references in peer-reviewed publications.
